intro: Onagra lamarckiana, commonly known as the yellow balsam, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy stems and leaves. Its seeds are encased in a hairy, triangular capsule that splits open to release the seeds. Onagra lamarckiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for cultivation.
